Science 2011 Jan 14 331 6014 176 82 doi 10 1126 science 1199644 Epub 2010 Dec 16 Quantitative analysis of culture using millions of digitized books Michel JB1 Shen YK Aiden AP Veres A Gray MK Google Books Team Pickett JP Hoiberg D Clancy D Norvig P Orwant J Pinker S Nowak MA Aiden EL Author information 1 Program for Evolutionary Dynamics Harvard University Cambridge MA 02138 USA jb michel gmail com Abstract We constructed a corpus of digitized texts containing about 4 of all books ever printed Analysis of this corpus enables us to investigate cultural trends quantitatively We survey the vast terrain of culturomics focusing on linguistic and cultural phenomena that were reflected in the English language between 1800 and 2000 We show how this approach can provide insights about fields as diverse as lexicography the evolution of grammar collective memory the adoption of technology the pursuit of fame censorship and historical epidemiology Culturomics extends the boundaries of rigorous quantitative inquiry to a wide array of new phenomena spanning the social sciences and the humanities Comment in Culturomics periodicals gauge culture s pulse Science 2011 Culturomics statistical traps muddy the data Science 2011 Digital data Google books Wikipedia and the future of culturomics Science 2011 PMID 21163965 PMCID PMC3279742 DOI 10 1126 science 1199644 Indexed for MEDLINE Free PMC
